column15: Active learning was limited during the lesson. The teacher mainly relied on PowerPoint slides and verbal questioning, which restricted student participation and hands-on engagement. column17: Technology was used through a PowerPoint presentation and a video clip. However, the use of technology was not effective in supporting learning. The video clip, though relevant, was not integrated meaningfully into the discussion or followed by questioning to assess understanding. The technology was used more as a presentation tool rather than an interactive learning resource.
column19: Assessment for learning was weak. Questioning strategies did not effectively check for understanding or encourage higher-order thinking. column27: Students’ progress was inconsistent due to the passive nature of learning activities.
